member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.Assembly
member.summary: The Assembly class defines a single manufacturing unit: objects that are bolted or welded together in the workshop. An assembly has a main part and secondary assemblables attached to it. The number of secondaries is limited to 2048. Hierarchical assemblies can also have subassemblies attached to them and they can have a parent assembly instance.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Assembly.GetSecondaries
member.summary: Selects and returns all the secondary assemblables belonging to the assembly. The method replaces the old GetObjects() method. Notice that the number of secondaries is limited to 2048.
member.returns: An array list containing all the secondary assemblables belonging to the assembly.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Assembly.Add(Tekla.Structures.Model.IAssemblable)
member.summary: Adds the given assemblable instance to the assembly. Notice that adding other than assembly instances will assume that you are adding objects to a cast unit assembly.
member.param: The part instance to add to the assembly.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Assembly.Add(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Adds an array list of given assemblable instances to the assembly. For assemblies use Add(Assembly Assembly). Notice that adding other than assembly instances will actually assume that you are adding objects to a cast unit assembly.
member.param: A list of assemblables to add to the assembly.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Assembly.Remove(Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObject)
member.summary: Removes the given instance from the assembly. Before removing steel parts from an assembly all connecting workshop welds and bolts must be deleted.
member.param: The model object to remove from the assembly.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Assembly.Insert
member.summary: Inserts the instance in the model. At the moment only rebar assemblies can be inserted. The main object of the assembly must be a or . If the main rebar is not set (null), the main rebar will be automatically set to the secondary rebar with the biggest weight.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart
member.summary: The BooleanPart class represents a part cut or an add. This means that a model object is, for example, cut with a part instance to create a void to the father part. Typically the operative part is deleted after the boolean cut operation. In case of boolean add, operative part is deleted automatically.

member.summary: Defines the boolean operation: an add or a cut.

member.summary: Defines the add part. Typically the add part type is not used.

member.summary: Defines the cut part.

member.summary: Defines the weld prep part.

member.summary: A constant string that defines a part class name to be the boolean operative part. This class must be used when inserting the operative part to the database.

member.summary: Defines the boolean operation: an add or a cut.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart.OperativePart
member.summary: The part that does the boolean operation. When Insert() is called, this field is overwritten with a new part instance which is a copy of the original operative part. This part has the same identifier as the boolean part. Modifications (such as profile change) have to be made through the part instance and not the boolean part instance. The operative part's class must be BooleanOperativeClass.

member.summary: Instantiates an empty cut operation.

member.param: The operative part for the boolean.

member.summary: Selects a boolean part from the model database. The part ID must be set.

Radius of the arc located at the given height. Must be positive

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the cone lateral boundaries and the center line. This is the recommended constructor if fine grained control is desired over the lateral boundaries of the surface

The second lateral boundary
The center line of the cone/cylinder

A vector normal to the circular cross sections of the surface. It defines the rotation axis from the start of a lateral boundary to the end of the same lateral boundary, according to the right hand rule.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with given parameters. The boundaries are defined by the side boundaries (i.e. generator lines of the surface).
member.remarks: This constructor may be numerically instable if the end faces are very close

The second end face normal.
The first side boundary.
The second side boundary.
member.exception: Throws exception if one of the arguments has null value.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with given parameters. The boundaries are defined by the lateral boundaries (i.e. the points on the sides of the curved part of the surface). member.remarks: This constructor may be numerically instable if the end faces are very close
member.param: The first end face normal.
The second end face normal.
The first lateral boundary
The second lateral boundary
member.exception: Throws an exception if one of the arguments is null.
Throws this exception if the boundaries are invalid.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.ConnectiveGeometry
member.summary: A class for geometry formed of several geometry sections. Geometry is initialized with polygon geometry and then can be extended by calling one of AddLeg methods using BentPlateGeometrySolver class. In the case of success, two polygon geometries will be connected by cylindrical surface geometry possibly with help of additional polygon geometries. Resulted geometry, then, can be set to bent plate.

member.summary: Valid polymesh

member.summary: Number of vertices in innerloop too small

member.summary: Check of indices of vertices in outer loop failed

member.summary: Check of indices of vertices in the innerloop failed

member.summary: Inner loop is not inside the outer loop

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshHealthCheckEnum.VertexArrayForListOfEdges
member.summary: Check of indices of vertices for edge list failed

member.summary: Outer loop points are not in the same plane with each other

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshHealthCheckEnum.NonPlanarInnerloop
member.summary: Inner loop points are not in the same plane with each other or with outer loop

member.summary: Outer loop is self-intersecting

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshHealthCheckEnum.SelfIntersectingInnerloop
member.summary: Inner loop is self-intersecting

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshHealthCheckEnum.LoopNormalsInvalid
member.summary: Inner loop normal direction should be opposite to outer loop

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshHealthCheckEnum.FaceEdgesInvalidOrientation
member.summary: Two neighbor faces with common edge have wrong orientation

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshHealthCheckEnum.FaceEdgesPartlyInvalidOrientation
member.summary: Two neighbor faces with partly common edge have wrong orientation

member.summary: Polymesh consists topologically of multiple shells

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshHealthCheckEnum.MultishellPolymeshByGeometry
member.summary: Polymesh consists geometrically of multiple shells

member.summary: Number of faces too small

member.summary: The vertex array contains vertices that are geometrically equivalent

member.summary: The same vertex index appears at least twice for a face

member.summary: The face has at least one vertex that is collinear with others on an edge

member.summary: The polymesh contains non-manifold edges

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshHealthCheckEnum.UnusedVertices
member.summary: The polymesh contains unused vertices

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags
member.summary: Polymesh check flags, please refer to PolymeshHealthCheckEnum for the corresponding result values.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.None
member.summary: Perform no check

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.LoopVertexUnique
member.summary: To check that no two consecutive vertex index may be the same.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.VerticesOnSameEdge
member.summary: To check outerloop vertices on same edge, distance tolerance 0.01.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.OuterloopPlanarity
member.summary: To check outerloop's planarity, IN_PLANE_EPSILON 1.0e-3.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.OuterloopSelfIntersection
member.summary: To check if outerloop intersects itself, EPSILON 1.E-4

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.InnerloopPlanarity
member.summary: To check innterloop's planarity, IN_PLANE_EPSILON 1.0e-3.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.InnerloopSelfIntersection
member.summary: To check if innerloop intersects itself, EPSILON 1.E-4.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.InnerloopInsideOuterloop
member.summary: To check if innerloop inside outerloop, EPSILON 1.E-4.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.LoopNormalValidity
member.summary: The inner loop is oriented clockwise, the opposite of the outer loop (counterclockwise).

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.FaceEdgeOrientation
member.summary: To check face's edge orientation.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.Multishellness
member.summary: To check are there more than one topologically connected components in the polymesh. This checks only through vertex indexes.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.MultishellnessGeometrical
member.summary: To check are there more than one geometrically connected components in the polymesh. Check with all vertex edge face position containment (includes partial edge touching cases). This check can be slow, the behavior is O(n^2).

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.VerticesOnSamePosition
member.summary: To check if there are any vertices that are in the same location, EPSILON 0.01.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.UnusedVertices
member.summary: To check if there are any unused vertices in the vertex array.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.NonManifoldEdges
member.summary: Are there non-manifold edges (indirect edge vertices are found for more than 2 faces).

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.NullFaces
member.summary: To check if all vertices of the face are linearly dependent, or having less than 3 vertices, or smaller than allowed edges.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Polymesh.PolymeshCheckerFlags.All
member.summary: To check all criteria.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.History.ModelHistory.TakeModifications(System.String,Tekla.Structures.Model.History.ModificationStamp)
member.summary: Take modifications since previous call.
member.remarks: Takes modification which has happened to the model since the previous call to TakeModifications with the same Name argument. If there was no previous call with this Name, shows modifications since beginning, or since PrevStap, if it is specified. Updates internal reference for use when TakeModifications() is called next time.
member.param: Name of reference which is used for collecting modifications and which is updated. Intended use is to assign an unique name for each client application which needs to be informed of the model updates. Maximum length is 79 characters.
When specified, default value of reference if is it not found
member.returns: All modifications which happened since the last call. See ModificationInfo reference

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.History.ModelHistory.TakeModifications(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObject.ModelObjectEnum},Tekla.Structures.Model.History.ModificationStamp)
member.summary: Take modifications since previous call, with object type filtering.
member.remarks: Same as , but returns only the types listed in . Note that since this function also sets base for the next invocation of TakeModifications() for ALL objects, so using it discards change information for filtered objects.
member.param: Name of reference which is used for collecting modifications and which is updated. Intended use is to assign an unique name for each client application which needs to be informed of the model updates. Maximum length is 79 characters.
Types of object to select. Empty or null selects all types.
When specified, default value of reference if is it not found
member.returns: All modifications which happened since the last call. See ModificationInfo reference

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.LoadGroup
member.summary:
The LoadGroup class implements grouping functionality related to all loads. Each load should be assigned to a load group. Each load group contains loads caused by the same action and to which you want to refer collectively.
Tekla Structures assumes that all loads in a group
Have the same partial safety and other combination factors
Have the same action direction
Occur at the same time and all together
You may create new load groups, modify existing ones and delete load groups via the .NET interface. You may also change the assigned load group of a load and list all the load groups found in the model via the ModelObjectSelector interface. The model always has at least one load group.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.LoadGroup.Compatible
member.summary:
This variable is used to store information on which groups are compatible with each other in structural analysis load combination.
Load combination is a process in which some simultaneously acting load groups are multiplied by their partial safety factors and combined with each other according to specific rules. To accurately combine loads which have the same load group type, you need to identify which load groups can occur at the same time, i.e. are compatible. This variable stores one integer, and all groups who have this same integer are known to be compatible with each other. Depending on the analysis needs, they may be calculated together, in smaller combinations, or separately.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.LoadGroup.Incompatible
member.summary:
This variable is used to store information on which groups exclude each other in structural analysis load combination.
Load combination is a process in which some simultaneously acting load groups are multiplied by their partial safety factors and combined with each other according to specific rules. To accurately combine loads which have the same load group type, you need to identify which load groups exclude each other, i.e. are incompatible. This variable stores one integer, and all groups who have this same integer are known to be incompatible with each other.

member.summary: The load magnitude is uniform across the loaded length.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.LoadLine.LineLoadFormEnum.LOAD_FORM_LINE_2
member.summary: The load has different magnitudes at the ends of the loaded length. The magnitude changes linearly between the ends.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.LoadLine.LineLoadFormEnum.LOAD_FORM_LINE_3
member.summary: The load magnitude changes linearly, from zero at the ends of the loaded length, to a fixed value in the middle of the loaded length.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.LoadLine.LineLoadFormEnum.LOAD_FORM_LINE_4
member.summary: The load magnitude changes linearly, from zero at one end of the loaded length, through two (different) values, back to zero at the other end.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.DeformingData
member.summary: The DeformingData class holds information about the deforming of parts. Deformed parts are parts that have been warped, cambered or shortened.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.DeformingData.Angle
member.summary:
The angle of the part at its start point, relative to the part reference line.
For example, if the beam is warped 45 degrees at the end point, in the Angle field the value is 0, and the value is 45 in the Angle2 field.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.DeformingData.Angle2
member.summary:
The angle of the part at its end point, relative to the part reference line.
For example, if the beam is warped 45 degrees at the end point, in the Angle field the value is 0, and the value is 45 in the Angle2 field.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.Events
member.summary: The Events class allows the user to register event listeners for model events.
member.remarks:
Asynchronous event handling
Registered event handlers are called asynchronously so that many handlers may be running simultaneously. Event handlers are not guaranteed to be run in the same thread where they were registered. The asynchronous nature of the events requires the use of synchronization constructs on objects and data structures that are not defined to be thread safe.
Microsoft's documentation about the lock statement: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/c5kehkcz.aspx
Microsoft's documentation about delegates: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/900fyy8e.aspx
Microsoft's documentation about managed threading: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1c9txz50.aspx

member.summary:
The ModelChanged event is raised just after some changes have been made to the model.

member.summary: The ModelObjectNumbered event is raised when model object is numbered.

member.summary:

member.summary: The TeklaStructuresExit event is raised just before Tekla Structures exits. After this event has been called the user will no longer be able to perform any calls to Tekla Structures.

member.summary: The ClashDetected event is raised just after the detection of each clash. The clash information is saved before the event is triggered.

member.summary: Copies the elements of the to an , starting at a particular index.
member.param: The one-dimensional that is the destination of the elements copied from the . The must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.
member.exception: The array is null.
The index is less than zero.

The array is multidimensional, or the index is equal to or greater than the length of the array, or the number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from the index to the end of the destination array.
The type of the source cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Model.CommitChanges
member.summary: Commits the changes made to the model database so far. One commit is something that a user can later on undo with the undo command. A commit also launches the drawing of the changed product model to the visible views. A dependent plug-in should never call CommitChanges, since this would make undo very difficult for the user to do. However, non-dependent plug-ins require a separate commit if new objects are created.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Model.CommitChanges(System.String)
member.summary: Commits the changes made to the model database so far. One commit is something that a user can later on undo with the undo command. A commit also launches the drawing of the changed product model to the visible views. A plug-in should never call CommitChanges, since this would make undo very difficult for the user to do.
member.param: The message to be saved with the commit.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObject.ModificationTime
member.summary: Gets latest time of the object was modified or created.
member.remarks: The returned time is time of history revision which the object belongs to. For Sharing it is WriteOut time, for multiuser is save time. If history it not written then this method returns null.
member.returns: The date, if it was possible to retrieve it, null otherwise.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObject.IsUpToDate
member.summary: Gets if the object does not have a modification which is not shared.
member.returns: True if object was written out (for sharing) or saved (for multiuser) after last editing.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObject.ModificationTimeInfo
member.summary: Gets modification time and local modification for the object. The info is retrieved from Core once during ModelObject instance lifetime, then cached.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObjectEnumerator
member.summary: The ModelObjectEnumerator class provides the means to iterate through model object instances in the current model.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObjectEnumerator.SelectInstances
member.summary: Indicates that the instance Select() is called when the 'Current' item is asked from the enumerator. The user can set this to 'false' if no members are ever asked from the instance. This is the case when, for example, asking only a report property from the identifier. Warning: normally the user should not change this value.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObjectEnumerator.AutoFetch
member.summary: Indicates that the objects are fetched from the model when the enumerator is created. Object information is therefore not anymore fetched when 'Current' item is asked from the enumerator. Warning: changing of TransformationPlane after creation of enumerator or during the enumeration requires a separate selection of object for refreshing the values. Property value is used for all enumerators in application

member.summary: Returns an enumerator of the model objects in the current model colliding with the given geometrical bounding box. Note that this method uses approximate bounding boxes and thus is NOT EXACT, and may return objects not necessarily colliding with the given box but only being somewhere near to it.

The maximum point of the bounding box.
member.returns: A model object enumerator of the model objects colliding with the given bounding box.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.IsNumberingUpToDate(Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObject)
member.summary: Checks whether the numbering is up-to-date for an assembly, part, rebar, surface treatment, pour object or break.
member.param: The model object to check. The object must be an assembly, a part, a rebar or an inherited object.
member.exception: Thrown if the is not of a correct type or if it is not valid.
member.returns: True if the numbering information is up-to-date.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.IsNumberingUpToDateAll
member.summary:
Checks whether the numbering is up-to-date for every assembly, part and rebar on the model.
Using this method is much faster than checking each object individually.
member.returns: True if the numbering information is up-to-date.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.IsNumberingAllowed
member.summary: Checks whether the numbering is allowed or not in the current configuration.
member.returns: True if the numbering is allowed.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.GetSimilarNumberedObjects(Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObject)
member.summary: Gets similar objects based on numbering of given object.
member.remarks: This method works currently only with parts and assemblies.
member.param: The object for comparison.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.CreateReportFromSelected(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a report from the selected objects using the given template name and filename.
If a path is not given in the filename, the file is created to the folder defined with the advanced option XS_REPORT_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY.
If the given folder does not exist, the report creation fails.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about reports.
member.param: The name of the report template to be used in report creation. The name must contain more than three characters.
The name of the created report. The name must contain more than three characters.
The first title for the created report.
The second title for the created report.
The third title for the created report.
member.exception: Thrown when the or is null.
Thrown when the or is too short.
member.returns: True if the report is created.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.DisplayReport(System.String)
member.summary:
Opens and displays a report with the given name.
If a path is not given in the filename, the file is searched from the folder defined with the advanced option XS_REPORT_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about reports.
member.param: The name of the report to display. The name must contain more than three characters.
member.exception: Thrown when the file specified in the is not found or when the is too short.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.CreateReportFromAll(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a report from all the objects using the given template name and filename.
If a path is not given in the filename, the file is created to the folder defined with the advanced option XS_REPORT_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY.
If the given folder does not exist, the report creation fails.
Internally, this method is asynchronous, and because of that the output file cannot be immediately available.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about reports.
member.param: The name of the report template to be used in report creation. The name must contain more than three characters.
The name of the created report. The name must contain more than three characters.
The first title for the created report.
The second title for the created report.
The third title for the created report.
member.exception: Thrown when the or is null.
Thrown when the or is too short.
member.returns: True if the report is created.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.RunMacro(System.String)
member.summary:
Starts a macro with the given name. Throws an exception if the file is not found.
Macros are saved as *.cs files in the folder defined with the XS_MACRO_DIRECTORY variable.
It is possible to run drawing macros using relative paths.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about macros.
member.param: The name of the macro to start.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.IsMacroRunning
member.summary:

Macros are saved as *.cs files in the folder defined with the XS_MACRO_DIRECTORY variable.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about macros.
member.returns: True if a macro is running.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.DisplayPrompt(System.String)
member.summary: Displays a message in the status bar.
member.remarks:
Prompts
Tekla Structures prefixes the given prompt with "prompt_" and looks for a translation in the prompts.ail file. If the translation (e.g. "prompt_Pick_first_position") is not found in the prompts.ail file, the prompt string is displayed as such. This feature can be used to give already translated strings to the picker.
member.param: The message to display.
member.exception: Thrown when the is null.
member.returns: True if the message could be displayed.

member.returns: True if the object matches to the given filter criteria.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.Task
member.summary: The Task class defines a single building site task. It may contain parts, assemblies or other tasks. Tasks may have a hierarchy between them i.e. there are other tasks as subtasks for a parent task. Tasks may also depend on each other, have resources assigned to them or have a single worktype.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.TaskDependency
member.summary:
The TaskDependency class represents a dependency between two task objects. Each task may depend on many other tasks, but between two specific tasks only one type of a dependency may exist.
There are four types of dependencies:
FINISH_TO_FINISH (FF)
FINISH_TO_START (FS)
START_TO_FINISH (SF)
START_TO_START (SS)

member.summary:
Gets or sets the shape of the hook. The options are:
NO_HOOK. Sets the angle, radius and length to 0.
HOOK_90_DEGREES.
HOOK_135_DEGREES.
HOOK_180_DEGREES.
CUSTOM_HOOK. The angle, radius and length values have to be set manually.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarSpacingZone
member.summary: The RebarSpacingZone class defines the properties of a single spacing zone. The spacing properties of number of spaces, spacing and length are proposed properties that the spacing algorithm uses as input when calculating the final reinforcing bars spacing. Depending on the RebarSpacingZone properties and any other rebar spacing zones defined on the associated the spacing algorithm may determine a different final reinforcing bars spacing from the original proposed properties. However the RebarSpacingZone properties will always contain the original proposed values.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarSpacingZone.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: The length is an absolute value.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarSpacingZone.LengthEnum.RELATIVE
member.summary: The length is a relative value.

member.summary: The spacing type.

member.summary: The spacing is exact.

member.summary: The spacing is a target value.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarSpacingZone.NumberOfSpaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the proposed number of spaces in the spacing zone.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarSpacingZone.Spacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the proposed spacing (the space between each reinforcing bar centerline) in the spacing zone.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarSpacingZone.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the proposed overall spacing zone length.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarSpacingZone.NumberOfSpacesType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the number of spaces is exact or target. If the number of spaces is target the spacing algorithm may determine a different number of spaces to use.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarSpacingZone.SpacingType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the spacing is exact or target. If the spacing is target the spacing algorithm may determine a different spacing to use.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarSpacingZone.LengthType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the length is absolute or relative. If the length is relative the length property is treated as a proportion of the overall available spacing length (from the associated ). The available spacing length is the guideline length less the calculated start and end offsets and less any fixed length spacing zones. An example of how relative length values are handled: With two relative length zones with proposed length values of 10 and 20 respectively the final calculated lengths will normally be 'available spacing length'*10/(10+20) and 'available spacing length'*20/(10+20) though the spacing algorithm may determine a different result in some situations.

member.summary: Retrieves a list of physical reinforcing bars (of type RebarGeometry). These objects contain physical points in the 3D space of each reinforcing bar.
member.param: The options.
member.returns: An array list that contains the RebarGeometry objects.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetRebarGeometries(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of physical reinforcing bars (of type RebarGeometry). These objects contain physical points in the 3D space of each reinforcing bar.
member.param: A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
member.returns: An array list that contains the RebarGeometry objects.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetRebarGeometriesWithoutClashes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of physical reinforcing bars (of type RebarGeometry). These objects contain physical points in the 3D space of each reinforcing bar as shown in model view. In case rebar polygon clashes with itself, physical points are moved to avoid clashing.
member.param: A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
member.returns: An array list that contains the RebarGeometry objects.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetRebarComplexGeometries(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of physical reinforcing bars (of type ReinforcingBar). These objects contain physical curves in the 3D space of each reinforcing bar as shown in model view. In case rebar polygon clashes with itself, physical points are moved to avoid clashing. ReinforcingBar only differs from RebarGeometry by containing a Polycurve rather than a Polyline.
member.param: A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
A parameter to determine whether self-clash avoidance should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
A parameter to determine whether rounding and step tapering should be included in the rebar geometry or not.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetRebarComplexGeometries(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.RebarGeometrySimplificationTypeEnum)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of physical reinforcing bars (of type ReinforcingBar). These objects contain physical curves in the 3D space of each reinforcing bar as shown in model view. In case rebar polygon clashes with itself, physical points are moved to avoid clashing. ReinforcingBar only differs from RebarGeometry by containing a Polycurve rather than a Polyline.
member.param: A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
A parameter to determine whether self-clash avoidance should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
A parameter to determine whether rounding and step tapering should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
A parameter to determine whether the "simplified" rebar shape recognition geometry should be returned.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.IsGeometryValid
member.summary: Tells whether the geometry of a reinforcement object is valid or not.
member.returns: True if the geometry of the reinforcement is valid, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetNumberOfRebars
member.summary: Returns the number of rebars in the reinforcing group.
member.returns: The number of rebars in the rebar group.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetSingleRebar(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a single rebar inside the rebar group located by the given index. The indexing starts from the start point. The rebar represents a physical reinforcing bar and contains physical points in the 3D space of the bar. The method returns null on error, for example if given an erroneous index. The number of rebars in the group can be requested with GetNumberOfRebars().
member.param: The index of the rebar in the group.
A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
member.returns: The instance of a RebarGeometry object that contains the point list of the single physical reinforcing bar. Null if the given index was not valid.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetSingleRebarWithoutClash(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a single rebar inside the rebar group located by the given index. The indexing starts from the start point. The rebar represents a physical reinforcing bar and contains physical, non-clashing points in the 3D space of the bar. The method returns null on error, for example if given an erroneous index. The number of rebars in the group can be requested with GetNumberOfRebars().
member.param: The index of the rebar in the group.
A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
member.returns: The instance of a RebarGeometry object that contains the point list of the single physical reinforcing bar. Null if the given index was not valid.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.SelectInnerRebars(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Selects the physical rebars inside the group. These rebars contain for example physical points of the rebar. The function fetches all physical rebars for the structure. Due to remoting limitations, they may be fetched with several subsequent remote calls when handling a big reinforcement structure. This may cause some overhead. The function is only called once, when first inquiry about the physical rebarsis made.
member.param: Parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included or not.
Parameter to determine whether the polygon points should be moved to avoid clashing or not.
Parameter to determine whether the bar should have round and step tapering applied.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetComplexGeometries(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.RebarGeometrySimplificationTypeEnum)
member.summary: Gets the "complex" geometries of the bars.
member.param: A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
A parameter to determine whether self-clash avoidance should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
A parameter to determine whether rounding and step tapering should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
A parameter to determine whether the "simplified" rebar shape recognition geometry should be returned.

An array list of indices (of type integer) pointing to the points array list. Three consecutive indices represent a single triangle. The first index is 0. If null, the mesh will not contain any triangles.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.UI.Picker
member.summary: The Picker class can be used to query the user to do manual picks of objects and points from the Tekla Structures model. The methods throw an exception if the user interrupts (cancels) the pick command.
member.remarks:
Prompts
Tekla Structures prefixes the given prompt with "prompt_" and looks for a translation in the prompts.ail file. If the translation (e.g. "prompt_Pick_first_position") is not found in the prompts.ail file, the prompt string is displayed as such. This feature can be used to give already translated strings to the picker.

member.summary: Synchronization class for .NET picking and synced commands where we start a command and wait for it to complete.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.ModelInternal.Synchronize.GetSyncCallback
member.summary: Get sync callback to Sync()

members.member:
CDelegate includes all the platform invoke commands user process can call. It uses CDelegateSynchronized to deliver the calls to C-interface.
Adding a new class to interface goes like this: 1. Add a new delegate function type to definitions in this class. 2. Add Create/Select/Modify functions according to examples to this class. 3. Add Matching EndInvoke function to CDelegateSynchronized class. 4. Add Create/Select/Modify functions according to examples to CDelegateSynchronized 5. Add public static extern int functions for Create/Select/Modify to the end of CDelegateSynchronized. 6. Implement the static functions to TS. 7. Test

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.ModelInternal.InputGeometryEvents
member.summary: The InputGeometryEvents class allows the user to register event listeners for input geometry events.
member.remarks:
Asynchronous event handling
Registered event handlers are called asynchronously so that many handlers may be running simultaneously. Event handlers are not guaranteed to be run in the same thread where they were registered. The asynchronous nature of the events requires the use of synchronization constructs on objects and data structures that are not defined to be thread safe.
Microsoft's documentation about the lock statement: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/c5kehkcz.aspx
Microsoft's documentation about delegates: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/900fyy8e.aspx
Microsoft's documentation about managed threading: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1c9txz50.aspx

member.summary: The possible temporary states. Used to temporarily change color of a model object to visualize some state in the model. Only use a state for its named purpose. If you need to make some part orange even though it is not a modified part, talk to TORI or ERFA about adding a new state. Do not use DOT_TEMPORARY_STATE_MODIFIED unless the part is actually modified.

member.name: P:FlatBuffers.FlatBufferBuilder.ForceDefaults
member.summary:
Gets and sets a Boolean to disable the optimization when serializing default values to a Table.
In order to save space, fields that are set to their default value don't get serialized into the buffer.
